perturbation.original_text:
"End User" means each natural person that has access to Licensed Content on the Licensee Site.

"Gross Revenues" means the gross revenues received by the Licensee and derived from or in connection with the Licensee Site, from any sources whatsoever, including but not limited to fees for access to and use of the Licensee Site and advertising, sponsorship, marketing and other paid-for placements, andmaintenance, support and other services.
perturbation.changed_text:
"End User" means any person, whether natural or legal, that has access to Licensed Content on the Licensee Site.

"Gross Revenues" means the gross revenues received by the Customer and derived from or in connection with the Customer Site, from any sources whatsoever, including but not limited to fees for access to and use of the Licensee Site and advertising, sponsorship, marketing and other paid-for placements, andmaintenance, support and other services.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'End User' is broadened to include legal persons, contradicting the initial definition. 'Licensee' is also interchanged with 'Customer,' introducing confusion about the responsible party for revenue generation. This creates an uncertainty in who has the access for Licensee's Site, the party of this agreement or any customer.

perturbation.original_text: 3.  License Grants.   3.1 Content License. Subject to Licensee's on­going compliance with Section 3.2 and all other terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor grants to Licensee an exclusive (save for rights reserved to Licensor hereunder), non-transferable (except as provided in Section 11.7) and non- sublicensable license, during the License Term, to reproduce, perform, display, transmit and distribute the Licensed Content on the Licensee Siteand Related Media intended solely for use by End Usersin the Territory within the scope set forth in Schedule 1 (License Scope), which is attached hereto and incorporated herein by this reference. The foregoing includes the right to permit End Users to access the Licensed Content solely for their own end use and not for redistribution and otherwise subject to Terms of Use that comply with Section 4.3. Licensee is not granted any right to, and shall not, permit any other use of the Licensed Content by End Users, or any use of the Licensed Content by any other Person (including Licensee's Affiliates).
perturbation.changed_text: 3.  License Grants.   3.1 Content License. Subject to Customer's on­going compliance with Section 3.2 and all other terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor grants to Licensee an exclusive (save for rights reserved to Licensor hereunder), non-transferable (except as provided in Section 11.7) and non- sublicensable license, during the License Term, to reproduce, perform, display, transmit and distribute the Licensed Content on the Customer Site and Related Media intended solely for use by End Usersin the Territory within the scope set forth in Schedule 1 (License Scope), which is attached hereto and incorporated herein by this reference. The foregoing includes the right to permit End Users to access the Licensed Content solely for their own end use and not for redistribution and otherwise subject to Terms of Use that comply with Section 4.3. Licensee is not granted any right to, and shall not, permit any other use of the Licensed Content by End Users, or any use of the Licensed Content by any other Person (including Licensee's Affiliates).
perturbation.explanation: The use of 'Customer' instead of 'Licensee' to describe who must comply with the agreement's terms creates confusion regarding which entity is responsible for upholding the conditions of the license. Furthermore, the agreement states that Licensee is not permitted to use the Licensed Content by End Users or any Person, adding more complexity.

perturbation.original_text: 8. Indemnification.   8.1 By Licensor. Licensor shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Licensee against all Losses arising out of or resulting from any claim, suit, action or proceeding (each, an "Action") by an unaffiliated third party related to or arising out of a claim that the Licensed Content or Licensor's Marks, or Licensee's use thereof solely in compliance with this Agreement, infringes a copyright or trademark right of any third party registered in any country in the Territory. The foregoing obligation shall not apply to Losses for which Licensee is required to indemnify Licensor pursuant to Section 8.2.
perturbation.changed_text: 8. Indemnification.   8.1 By Supplier. Licensor shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Customer against all Losses arising out of or resulting from any claim, suit, action or proceeding (each, an "Action") by an unaffiliated third party related to or arising out of a claim that the Licensed Content or Licensor's Marks, or Licensee's use thereof solely in compliance with this Agreement, infringes a copyright or trademark right of any third party registered in any country in the Territory. The foregoing obligation shall not apply to Losses for which Licensee is required to indemnify Licensor pursuant to Section 8.2.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'Licensor' to 'Supplier' and 'Licensee' to 'Customer' within the indemnification clause, the agreement introduces uncertainty as to which entity (Licensor or Supplier) is actually providing the indemnification. Since both Licensor and Supplier are not defined, it will be unclear about the responsible party.
